title: Scientific Insight Northern Europe Coordinator
job_description:
Essential responsibilities & regular activities

  • Monitor & leverage our S&T Ecosystem - Drive our attention & make the junction with relevant teams at WUR - Make us & our strategical axes known at WUR & within the whole food valley -Identify other organizations  including start-ups relevant to our research axes, in NL but also in the rest of northern Europe
  • Broaden scientific culture in Research, Innovation & Development. Strengthen the scientific skills of the teams through the communication of internal research successes and focus points on external news relevant to the group’s strategy
  • Support the funding of research projects. Dutch & EU funding opportunities – Map the students’ projects/competitions opportunities

External representation: be able to present an aligned vision of Bel’s strategy on many scientific topics in but also out of his/her field of competency

Impact on Internal communication: be impactful & have ways to evaluate it

Impact on partnering: bring some collaboration opportunities aligned with our strategy

Prepare the future: think out of the box & one step ahead
requirements_description:
Requirements

Minimum level of education and professional experience needed:

PhD in any science related to our activities

Have lead research projects with multiple partners and at the junction of different fields of science

Know the Dutch Food Research ecosystem & ideally in surrounding countries

Specific knowledge (foreign languages, software, technical skills):

Broad scientific culture

Broad academic ecosystem in relevant universities in this zone

Know how to structure the financing & administrative aspects of a multi-partner project

Some insight in the Bel 5 research’s axis (alternative to dairy, naturalness, prediction of shelflife, pack-revolution & functional food)
conditions_description:
Conditions of employment

 Unlimited-term
